alert.note: Alert for Dickinson (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 26 at 9:24PM CST by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Dickinson County through 1000 PM CST... At 923 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles southwest of Solomon to 8 miles south of Carlton to 4 miles southeast of Canton. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Abilene, Herington, Chapman, Solomon, Enterprise, Hope, Woodbine and Carlton. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 268 and 287. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
